member.name: N:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that are used to develop and administer Notification Services instances and applications.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application
member.summary: Represents a Notification Services application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.#ctor(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Instance,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a parent object and a name.
member.param: The Notification Services that hosts the application. This parameter sets the property.

A between 1 and 64 characters in length, that specifies the name of the application. Each application in an instance must have a unique name.You cannot change the name. To rename an application, you must drop the application, define it with the new name, and then add it to the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.Disable
member.summary: Disables the application by recording a state change in the application database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.DisableSubscriptions
member.summary: Disables subscription management for the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.Enable
member.summary: Enables the application by recording a state change in the application database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.EnableSubscriptions
member.summary: Enables subscription management for the application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.ApplicationDatabaseOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the application database properties, which includes any specified data files and log files.
member.returns: An object that specifies the application database properties.

member.summary: Gets or sets the path and name of the application definition file (ADF).
member.returns: A , between 1 and 260 characters in length, specifying the path and name of the ADF.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.ApplicationDefinitionFileVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version number for the application definition.
member.returns: A object specifying the application definition version.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the application is enabled.
member.returns: true if the application is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.BaseDirectoryPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the base directory path for the application definition file (ADF).
member.returns: A , between 1 and 260 characters in length, specifying the path of the application's root folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.ChronicleQuantumLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer that specifies the logical (quantum) clock can fall behind the real-time clock before skipping event chronicle rule firings.
member.returns: A that specifies a number of quantum clock intervals.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.DatabaseName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application database.
member.returns: A , between 1 and 128 characters in length, specifying the name of the application database.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the application's distributors are enabled.
member.returns: true if distributors are enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.EventClasses
member.summary: Gets a object, which contains the set of event classes for the Notification Services application.
member.returns: A object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.EventProvidersEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the application's event providers are enabled.
member.returns: true if event providers are enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.EventThrottle
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of events that can be processed from a single event class during a single generator quantum.
member.returns: An value that specifies the maximum number of events that can be processed from a single event class during a single generator quantum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.Generator
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the application.
member.returns: A object, which is the generator for the application.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the application's generator is enabled.
member.returns: true if the generator is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.HostedEventProviders
member.summary: Gets a object, which contains the set of hosted event providers for the Notification Services application.
member.returns: A object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.LogBeforeDeliveryAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the distributor makes an entry in the distribution log before delivering a notification.
member.returns: true if pre-delivery logging is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.LogNotificationText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that configures the distributor to log all notification text from the delivery protocol for all notifications or just failed notifications.
member.returns: true if Notification Services logs all notification text; false if Notification Services logs notification text only for failed notifications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.LogStatusInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the distributor logs status information for all or just failed notifications.
member.returns: true if Notification Services logs status information for all notifications; false if Notification Services logs status information only for failed notifications.

member.summary: Gets a object, which contains the set of non-hosted event providers for the Notification Services application.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of notifications that can be processed in a single notification class during a single generator quantum.
member.returns: An value that specifies the maximum number of notifications that can be processed in a single notification class during a single generator quantum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.PerformanceQueryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that specifies how frequently the application updates its performance counters.
member.returns: A object that specifies how often the application updates its performance counters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.ProcessEventsInOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how the application processes event batches.
member.returns: true if Notification Services processes event batches in the order in which they arrived (sub-quantum sequencing); false if Notification Services processes all event batches that arrived during a quantum at the same time (quantum sequencing).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Nmo.Application.QuantumDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the length of time for a generator quantum, which determines how frequently the generator attempts to process work.
member.returns: A object that specifies the generator quantum duration.

member.returns: A value that contains a textual description of the backup set. By default, the value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.BackupSetName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name used to identify a particular backup set.
member.returns: A value that specifies the backup set name. By default, the value is set to an empty string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.BlockSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the block size unit to be used when formatting tapes as part of a backup.
member.returns: An value that specifies the block size. By default, the value is set to zero.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.ExpirationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when the backup set expires and the backup data is no longer considered relevant.
member.returns: A object value that specifies the expiration date. By default, the value is unspecified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.FormatMedia
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that determines whether a tape is formatted as the first step of the backup operation.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the tape will be formatted.If True, the MicrosoftSQL Server backup operation attempts to format the tape as the initial step.If False (default), the SQL Server backup operation does not attempt to format the tape.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.Incremental
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that determines whether to perform a differential backup.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether a differential backup will be performed.If True, only changes since the most recent full or differential backup will be included in the backup operation.If False (default), a full backup will be performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.Initialize
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that determines whether the devices associated with a backup operation are initialized as part of the backup operation.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the backup devices will be initialized.If True, the backup specified becomes the first backup set on the media, overwriting any existing backup sets on the media. The backup media is not overwritten if either of the following conditions is met: All backup sets on the media have not yet expired. The optionally specified backup set name does not match the name on the backup media. Specify the backup set name with the property. If False (default), the backup specified creates a new backup set appended as the last backup set on the medium.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.LogTruncation
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to truncate the database log as part of the backup operation.
member.returns: A object value that specifies the log truncation option that has been selected. By default, the value is set to .

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.MediaDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets a textual description of the medium that contains a backup set.
member.returns: A value that contains a textual description of the medium.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.Mirrors
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of backup devices used by the mirrored backup.
member.returns: An array of BackupDeviceList objects that specifies the backup devices used by the mirrored backup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.RetainDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of days that must elapse before a backup set can be overwritten.
member.returns: An value that specifies the retention period in days. By default, the value is set to zero.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.SkipTapeHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets property that determines whether the tape header is read.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the tape header is read.If True, a media name recorded on the medium is not selected. The backup set is appended to the medium.If False (default), a recorded media name is selected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Backup.UndoFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the undo file used to store uncommitted transactions that are rolled back during recovery.
member.returns: A value that specifies the undo file name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupActionType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the type of backup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupActionType.Database
member.summary: Backs up all the data files in the database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupActionType.Files
member.summary: Backs up specified data files. This option is recommended only when the transactions that have occurred since the last backup are isolated to the file or group of files that are being backed up.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupActionType.Log
member.summary: Backs up the transaction log.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupRestoreBase.NoRecovery
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that determines whether the tail of the log is backed up and whether the database is restored into the Restoring state.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the tape is rewound at the end of the operation.If True, the tail end of the log is not backed up. When restored, the database is in the Restoring state.If False (default), the tail end of the log is backed up.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupRestoreBase.NoRewind
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that determines whether MicrosoftSQL Server will keep the tape open after the backup or restore operation.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the tape is rewound at the end of the operation or not.If True, the tape drive is open and positioned.If False (default), the tape is rewound

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupRestoreBase.PercentCompleteNotification
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage interval for event handler calls.
member.returns: An that specifies the percentage interval for the event handler calls. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupRestoreBase.Restart
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that determines whether the backup or restore operation will restart if it is interrupted.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the operation will restart after an interruption. If True, SQL Server tries to continue processing on a partial backup or restore operation.If False (default), SQL Server restarts an interrupted backup or restore operation at the beginning of the backup set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupRestoreBase.UnloadTapeAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that determines whether tape media are rewound and unloaded after the backup or restore operation completes.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether tape media are rewound and unloaded after the backup or restore operation completes. If True, the tape medium in the tape device is rewound and unloaded when the operation completes.If False (default), no attempt is made to rewind and unload the tape medium.

member.summary: There is no asynchronous operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupRestoreBase.AsyncOperation.Restore
member.summary: The restore process is the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupTruncateLogType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the truncate action taken on the log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupTruncateLogType.NoTruncate
member.summary: The log is not truncated. All transactions remain in the log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupTruncateLogType.Truncate
member.summary: The log is truncated. All completed transactions will be removed from the log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupTruncateLogType.TruncateOnly
member.summary: The log is truncated and the transaction of truncating the log itself is not logged. This option is only recommended when the log is full.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the certificate. If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the certificate.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the certificate.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be denied access to the set of permissions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Certificate.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Grants the specified set of permissions to the grantee and the ability to grant the set of permissions to other users on the certificate under an assumed role.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the certificate.If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the certificate.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the certificate.
A value that specifies a grantee to be denied access to the permission.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting the specified set of permissions to other users on the certificate. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database.EnumLocks
member.summary: Enumerates a list of all current locks held on the database.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of locks held on the database and information about the type and location of the locks. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type DescriptionRequestorSpidThe system process ID value of the process that is holding a lock on a database resource.LockTypeThe description of the type of lock. See the syslockinfo table for a description of different lock types.DatabaseThe name of the database on which the lock is held.TableThe name of the table on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on a table.IndexThe name of the index on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on an index.StatusThe status of the lock, which can be one of the following:1 = Granted.2 = Converting.3 = Waiting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database.EnumLocks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of current locks held on the database for a specified system process ID.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of locks held on the database and information about the type and location of the locks. The table describes the different columns of the returned . ColumnData typeDescriptionRequestorSpidThe system process ID value of the process that is holding a lock on a database resource.LockTypeThe description of the type of lock. See the syslockinfo table for a description of different lock types.DatabaseThe name of the database on which the lock is held.TableThe name of the table on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on a table.IndexThe name of the index on which the lock is held. This field contains a value only if the lock is held on an index.StatusThe status of the lock, which can be one of the following:1 = Granted.2 = Converting.3 = Waiting.
member.param: An that specifies the process ID value that uniquely identifies the process.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant the set of permissions to other users on the database.If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting the specified set of permissions to other users on the database. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class on the specified database and with the specified name.
member.param: A value that specifies the name of the database DDL trigger.
A object value that specifies the database on which the database data definition language (DDL) trigger is created.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class on the specified database with the specified name. The trigger responds to the specified event set and runs the specified batch.
member.param: A object that specifies the DDL events to which the trigger responds.
A value that specifies the name of the database data definition language (DDL) trigger.
A object value that specifies the parent of the object.
A value that specifies the Transact-SQL batch statement that runs when the trigger has been raised.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.#ctor(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database,System.String,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTriggerEventSet,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class on the specified database with the specified name. The trigger responds to the specified event set and runs the specified batch.
member.param: A object that specifies the DDL events to which the DDL trigger responds.
A value that specifies the name of the database data definition language (DDL) trigger.
A value that specifies the name of the class in the registered assembly.
A object value that specifies the parent of the object.
A value that specifies the method within the class that runs when the DDL trigger is raised.
A value that specifies the name of the registered assembly that contains the user-defined function that runs when the DDL trigger is raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseDdlTrigger.AnsiNullsStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether SQL-92 NULL handling is enabled in the data definition language (DDL) trigger.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether SQL-92 NULL handling is enabled in the DDL trigger. SQL-92 NULL handling requires that any comparison to a NULL value equates to a NULL value.If True, SQL-92 NULL handling is enabled and comparisons to null values equate to False.If False (default), SQL-92 NULL handling is disabled and comparisons to null values equate to True.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the assembly that contains the managed code that is executed when the data definition language (DDL) trigger is raised.
member.returns: A value that specifies the name of the assembly.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the class in the assembly that contains the managed code that is executed when the data definition language (DDL) trigger is raised.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.SetSnapshotIsolation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the snapshot isolation level.
member.param: A value that specifies whether the snapshot isolation level is enabled.If True, the snapshot isolation level is enabled.If False, the snapshot isolation level is disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiNullDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULL_DEFAULT database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULL_DEFAULT database option is active or not.If True, user-defined data types default to allowing NULL values.If False (default), user-defined data types default to not allowing NULL values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiNullsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULLS_ENABLED database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_NULLS_ENABLED database option is active or not. If True, comparisons to null values equate to false.If False (default), comparisons to null values equate to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiPaddingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_PADDING_ENABLED database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_PADDING_ENABLED database option is active or not.If True, trailing blanks inserted into variable-length columns are not trimmed.If False (default), blanks inserted into variable-length columns are trimmed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AnsiWarningsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ANSI_WARNING_ENABLED database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ANSI_WARNING_ENABLED database option is active or not.If True, warnings are issued when null values are encountered in a statement.If False (default), warnings are not issued when null values are encountered in statements.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.ArithmeticAbortEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the ARITHMETICABORT database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the ARITHMETICABORT database option is active or not.If True, a transaction is stopped and rolled back when an arithmetic error occurs.If False (default), a transaction continues when an arithmetic error occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOCLOSE database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOCLOSE database option is active or not.If True, the database is closed, and its resources are freed when no user connection accesses the database.If False (default), the server maintains the database in an open and ready state regardless of user activity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoCreateStatistics
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOCREATESTATISTICS database option is active or not.
member.returns: value that specifies whether the AUTOCREATESTATISTICS database option is active or not.If True, statistics are automatically created.If False (default), statistics are not automatically created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoShrink
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOSHRINK database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOSHRINK database option is active or not. If True, the database is automatically reduced.If False (default), statistics are not automatically reduced.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoUpdateStatistics
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICS database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICS database option is active or not.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.AutoUpdateStatisticsAsync
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICSASYNC database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the AUTOUPDATESTATISTICSASYNC database option is active or not.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.BrokerEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the Service Broker service is enabled or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the Service Broker service is enabled or not.If True, statistics are automatically updated.If False (default), statistics are not automatically updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.CloseCursorsOnCommitEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the CURSOR_CLOSE_ON_COMMIT database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the CURSOR_CLOSE_ON_COMMIT database option is active or not.If True, the cursor is closed when a transaction commits.If False (default), the cursor is not closed when a transaction commits.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.ConcatenateNullYieldsNull
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL database option is active or not.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL database option is active or not.If True, the concatenated result is NULL.If False (default), the value is concatenated with a zero string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.DatabaseOwnershipChaining

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.DateCorrelationOptimization

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.IsParameterizationForced

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.LocalCursorsDefault

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.MirroringTimeout

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseOptions.NumericRoundAbortEnabled

member.param: An object value that specifies the set of permissions.
A value that specifies the grantee to be denied the specified set of permissions on the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Deny(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Denies the specified set of permissions for the specified grantee and other users that the grantee granted the specified set of permissions on the database role.
member.param: An object value that specifies the set of permissions.

A property that specifies whether users, to whom the grantee granted the specified set of permission, are also denied access to the specified set of permissions on the database role.If True, the grantee and users to which the grantee granted the specified set of permissions are all denied the specified set of permissions.If False, only the grantee is denied the specified set of permissions.
A value that specifies the grantee to be denied the specified set of permissions on the database role.

A array that specifies a list of grantees to be denied the specified set of permissions.

member.summary: Grants the specified set of permissions to the specified grantees on the database role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Grants access to the specified permission to the grantee and the ability to grant access to other users on the database role.
member.param: An object that specifies the set of permissions.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant the set of permissions to other users on the database role.If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role.
A value that specifies the grantee to be denied specified set of permissions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Grants access to the specified permission to the grantees and the ability to grant access to other users on the database role.
member.param: An object that specifies the set of permissions.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role. If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be denied access to the set of permissions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Grants permissions to other users on the database role under an assumed role.
member.param: An object that specifies the permission.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role.If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role.
A value that specifies a grantee to be denied access to the permission.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.DatabaseRole.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet,System.String[],System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Grants the specified set of permissions to the grantees and the ability to grant the set of permissions to other users on the database role under an assumed role.

A array that specifies a list of grantees to be granted the set of permissions.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting the specified set of permissions to other users on the database role. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption
member.summary: The enumeration is a list of constant values that specify the levels of detail of collected fragmentation information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption.Detailed
member.summary: Value = 3. Calculates statistics based on 100% of the data. This option is available with Microsoft SQL Server 2005 only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption.Fast
member.summary: Value = 1. Calculates statistics based on parent level pages only. This option is available with Microsoft SQL Server 2000 and SQL Server 2005.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.FragmentationOption.Sampled
member.summary: Value = 2. Calculates statistics on samples of data. This option is available with Microsoft SQL Server 2005 only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.EnumColumns
member.summary: Enumerates a list of columns that can be accessed on the linked server.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of tables that can be accessed on the linked server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . ColumnData typeDescriptionCOLUMN_SIZEThe number of significant digits in the column. The return value for the PRECISION column is in base 10.BUFFER_LENGTHThe transfer size of the data to and from the column.DECIMAL_DIGITSThe number of digits to the right of the decimal point.NUM_PREC_RADIXThe base for numeric data types.NULLABLEThe nullability of the column. 1 = NULL is possible. 0 = NOT NULL.REMARKSThis field always returns NULL.COLUMN_DEFThe default value of the column.SQL_DATA_TYPEThe value of the SQL data type as it appears in the TYPE field of the descriptor. This column is the same as the DATA_TYPE column, except for the DateTime and SQL-92 interval data types. This column always returns a value.SQL_DATETIMEE_SUBThe subtype code for DateTime and SQL-92 interval data types. For other data types, this column returns NULL.CHAR_OCTET_LENGTHThe maximum length in bytes of a character or integer data type column. For all other data types, this column returns NULL.ORDINAL_POSITIONThe ordinal position of the column in the table. The first column in the table is 1. This column always returns a value.IS_NULLABLEThe nullability of the column in the table. ISO rules are followed to determine nullability. An ISO SQL-compliant DBMS cannot return an empty string.YES = Column can include NULLS. NO = Column cannot include NULLS.This column returns a zero-length string if nullability is unknown.The value returned for this column is different from the value returned for the NULLABLE column.SS_DATA_TYPEThe ordinal position of the column in the table. The first column in the table is 1. This column always returns a value.

The return value for the PRECISION column is in base 10.BUFFER_LENGTHThe transfer size of the data to and from the column.DECIMAL_DIGITSThe number of digits to the right of the decimal point.NUM_PREC_RADIXThe base for numeric data types.NULLABLEThe nullability of the column. 1 = NULL is possible. 0 = NOT NULL.REMARKSThis field always returns NULL.COLUMN_DEFThe default value of the column.SQL_DATA_TYPEThe value of the SQL data type as it appears in the TYPE field of the descriptor. This column is the same as the DATA_TYPE column, except for the DateTime and SQL-92 interval data types. This column always returns a value.SQL_DATETIMEE_SUBThe subtype code for DateTime and SQL-92 interval data types. For other data types, this column returns NULL.CHAR_OCTET_LENGTHThe maximum length in bytes of a character or integer data type column. For all other data types, this column returns NULL.ORDINAL_POSITIONThe ordinal position of the column in the table. The first column in the table is 1. This column always returns a value.IS_NULLABLEThe nullability of the column in the table. ISO rules are followed to determine nullability. An ISO SQL-compliant DBMS cannot return an empty string.YES = Column can include NULLS. NO = Column cannot include NULLS.This column returns a zero-length string if nullability is unknown.The value returned for this column is different from the value returned for the NULLABLE column.SS_DATA_TYPEThe ordinal position of the column in the table. The first column in the table is 1. This column always returns a value.
member.param: A value that specifies the name of the schema
A value that specifies the name of the column.
A value that specifies the name of the database.
A value that specifies the name of the table.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.EnumTables
member.summary: Enumerates a list of tables that are available on the linked server.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of tables that can be accessed on the linked server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . ColumnData typeDescriptionTABLE_CATThe table qualifier name. Various DBMS products support three-part naming for tables (qualifier.owner.name). In SQL Server 2005, this column represents the database name. In some other products, it represents the server name of the database environment of the table. This field can be NULL.TABLE_SCHEMThe owner of the table in the linked server. In SQL Server, this column represents the name of the database user who created the table. This field always returns a value.TABLE_NAMEThe name of the table in the linked server. This field always returns a value.TABLE_TYPEThe type of table: table, system table, or view.REMARKS SQL Server does not return a value for this column.

This field can be NULL.TABLE_SCHEMThe owner of the table in the linked server. In SQL Server, this column represents the name of the database user who created the table. This field always returns a value.TABLE_NAMEThe name of the table in the linked server. member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.CollationCompatible
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the default collation of the linked server is compatible with the default collation on the local instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the remote linked server is compatible with the collation on the local instance of SQL Server. If True, the linked server has a default collation that is compatible with the default collation on the local instance of SQL Server.If False (default), the linked server has a default collation that is incompatible with the default collation on the local instance of SQL Server. This means that data compared on the two servers may return unexpected results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.LinkedServer.CollationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the collation to use when sorting data from the linked server.
member.returns: A value that specifies the name of the collation to use when sorting data from the linked server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Alter
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ALTER permission in the permission set. The permission lets the grantee change properties, except ownership, of the object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ALTER permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Connect

member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the CONNECT permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet.Control
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the CONTROL permission in the permission set. The permission gives the grantee full control over the object, including all defined permissions for the object, the ability to create permissions on the object, and full control over child objects.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the CONTROL permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

member.returns: A system object value that contains a list of Transact-SQL statements in the script.
member.param: A object value that is used to specify the script options.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.AllowInProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an in-process server.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an in-process server.If True, the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an in-process server.If False (default), the OLE DB provider is instantiated as an external process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.Description
member.summary: Gets a textual description of the OLE DB provider.
member.returns: A value that contains a textual description of the OLE DB provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.DisallowAdHocAccess
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether Microsoft SQL Server allows ad hoc access to data by using OPENROWSET and OPENDATASOURCE functions with the OLE DB provider.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether SQL Server allows ad hoc functions with the OLE DB provider.If True, ad hoc functions are not allowed.If False (default), ad hoc function are allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.DynamicParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the provider allows '?' parameter marker syntax for parameterized queries.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether Microsoft SQL Server allows parameterized queries with the OLE DB provider.If True, parameterized queries are allowed.If False (default), parameterized queries are not allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.IndexAsAccessPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider indexes are used to fetch data.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider indexes are used to fetch data.If True, the OLE DB provider indexes are used to fetch data.If False (default), the SQL Server indexes are used to fetch data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.LevelZeroOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether all OLE DB providers are supported or just those that are compliant with the level 0 OLE DB interface.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether all OLE DB providers are supported or just those that are compliant with the level 0 OLE DB interface.If True, only level 0 OLE DB providers are allowed.If False (default), all levels of OLE DB provider are allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.NestedQueries
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider allows nested SELECT statements in the FROM clause.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider allows nested SELECT statements in the FROM clause.If True, nested SELECT statements in the FROM clause of a SELECT statement are allowed.If False (default), nested SELECT statements are not allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.NonTransactedUpdates
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether data updates with the OLE DB provider are logged and are recoverable.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether data updates with the OLE DB provider are logged and are recoverable.If True, data updates are not logged on the OLE DB provider and cannot be recovered.If False (default), data updates are logged on the OLE DB provider and can be recovered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.OleDbProviderSettings.SqlServerLike

member.returns: A value that specifies whether the OLE DB provider supports the LIKE operator as it is implemented in SQL Server.If True, the LIKE operator behaves the same as in SQL Server. If False (default), the LIKE operator does not behave the same as in SQL Server.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a restore operation creates a new image of the restored database.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether a new image of the restored database will be created.If True, a new image of the database is created. A property that specifies whether users to whom the grantee has granted the specified set of permissions are also revoked the set of permissions.If True, the grantee and users to whom the grantee granted the specified set of permission are all revoked the specified set of permissions on the schema.If False, only the grantee is revoked the specified set of permissions.
A array that specifies a list of grantees to be revoked access to the set of permissions.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when revoking the specified set of permission from other users on the schema. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include header information at the beginning of the generated script.If True, header information is included.If False (default), header information is not included.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.IncludeIfNotExists
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether to check the existence of an object before including it in the script.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to check whether an objects exists before including it in the script.If True, the existence of an object is verified before including it in the script.If False (default), the existence of an object is not verified before including it in the script.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.Indexes
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether indexes are included in the generated script.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether indexes are included in the generated script.If True, indexes are included in the generated script.If False (default), indexes are not included in the generated script.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.LoginSid
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the security identifiers are included for any scripted logins in the generated script.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the security identifiers are included for any scripted logins in the generated script.If True, the security identifiers are included for any scripted logins in the generated script.If False (default), the security identifiers are not included for any scripted logins in the generated script.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.NoAssemblies
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether assemblies are included in the generated script.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether assemblies are included in the generated script.If True, assemblies are not included in the generated script.If False (default), assemblies are included in the generated script.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.NoCollation
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the collection in the generated script if the server is running SQL Server 7.0 or later.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the collation clause in the script.If True, the collation clause is not included.If False (default), the collation clause is included.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.NoCommandTerminator
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether individual Transact-SQL statements are delimited in the generated script.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether individual Transact-SQL statements are delimited in the generated script.If True, individual Transact-SQL statements are not delimited in the generated script.If False (default), individual Transact-SQL statements are delimited using the connection-specific command terminator.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.NoExecuteAs
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the EXECUTE AS options for stored procedures and user-defined functions are included in the script.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the EXECUTE AS options for stored procedures and user-defined functions are included in the script.If True, the EXECUTE AS options for stored procedures and user-defined functions are not included in the script.If False (default), the EXECUTE AS options for stored procedures and user-defined functions are included in the script.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ScriptingOptions.NoFileGroup

member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the file group clause in the generated script.If True, the file group clause is not included in the script.If False (default), the file group clause is included in the script.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumProcesses
member.summary: Enumerates a list of processes running on the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of processes running on the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description UrnThe URN string that represents the process. "Server[@Name='PCNAME']/Process[@Spid='51']", for example.NameThe name of the process.SpidThe SQL Server process ID that uniquely identifies the process, see sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).LoginThe login running the process.HostThe name of the computer on which the process is running.StatusThe status of the process. Running and sleeping, for example.CommandThe command currently being executed.DatabaseThe database is which the process is running.CpuThe cumulative time taken by the process in seconds. See sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).MemUsageThe number of pages in the procedure cache that are currently allocated to the process. A negative number indicates that the process is freeing up memory allocated by another process.BlockingSpidThe SQL Server procedure ID of the procedure that is blocking the referenced procedure..IsSystemThe value that specifies whether the process is a system process or not.ProgramThe name of the program the process ExecutionContextIDThe ID value that uniquely identifies the execution context under which the process is running.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumProcesses(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of processes running on the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server with the option to exclude system processes.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of processes running on the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description UrnThe URN string that represents the process. "Server[@Name='PCNAME']/Process[@Spid='51']", for example.NameThe name of the process.SpidThe SQL Server process ID that uniquely identifies the process, see sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).LoginThe login running the process.HostThe name of the computer on which the process is running.StatusThe status of the process. Running and sleeping, for example.CommandThe command currently being executed.DatabaseThe database is which the process is running.CpuThe cumulative time taken by the process in seconds. See sys.sysprocesses (Transact-SQL).MemUsageThe number of pages in the procedure cache that are currently allocated to the process. A negative number indicates that the process is freeing up memory allocated by another process.BlockingSpidThe SQL Server procedure ID of the procedure that is blocking the referenced procedure..IsSystemThe value that specifies whether the process is a system process or not.ProgramThe name of the program the process ExecutionContextIDThe ID value that uniquely identifies the execution context under which the process is running.
member.param: A value that specifies whether to include system processes in the results.If True, system processes are excluded.If False, system processes are included.

member.summary: Enumerates a list of Microsoft Windows group accounts defined for the specified domain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumWindowsGroupInfo
member.summary: Enumerates a list of information about all Microsoft Windows groups that have explicitly granted access to the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.
member.returns: A system object value that contains a list of Windows groups that have explicitly granted access to the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description account nameThe name of the Windows NT user. NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM, for example.typeThe type of user. This specifies whether the user is an individual account or a group account.privilegeThe privilege level assigned to the Windows NT group.mapped login nameThe SQL Server login account to which the Windows NT group is mapped.permission pathThe permission path for the Windows NT group.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumWindowsGroupInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of information about all Microsoft Windows groups that have explicitly granted access to the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.
member.returns: A system object value that contains a list of Windows groups that have explicitly granted access to the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description account nameThe name of the Windows NT user. NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM, for example.typeThe type of user. This specifies whether the user is an individual account or a group account.privilegeThe privilege level assigned to the Windows NT group.mapped login nameThe SQL Server login account to which the Windows NT group is mapped.permission pathThe permission path for the Windows NT group.
member.param: A value that specifies a Windows group on which to limit the results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumWindowsGroupInfo(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of information about all Microsoft Windows groups that have explicitly granted access to the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server and with the option to list the individual members.
member.returns: Updated text:A system object value that contains a list of Windows groups that have explicitly granted access to the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description account nameThe name of the Windows NT user. NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM, for example.typeThe type of user. This specifies whether the user is an individual account or a group account.privilegeThe privilege level assigned to the Windows NT group.mapped login nameThe SQL Server login account to which the Windows NT group is mapped.permission pathThe permission path for the Windows NT group.
member.param: A value that specifies whether to list the members of the Windows group that has been granted access to the instance of SQL Server.If True, the individual members are listed.If False, the individual members are not listed.
A value that specifies a Windows group on which to limit the results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumWindowsUserInfo
member.summary: Enumerates a list of information about all Microsoft Windows users that have explicitly granted access to MicrosoftSQL Server.
member.returns: A system object value that contains a list of Windows users that have explicitly granted access to the instance of SQL Server.The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description account nameThe name of the Windows NT user. typeThe type of user. This specifies whether the user is an individual account or a group account.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumWindowsUserInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of information about all Microsoft Windows users that have explicitly granted access to the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.EnumWindowsUserInfo(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of information about all Microsoft Windows users that have explicitly granted access to the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server and with the option to list all the permissions paths (groups) through which the user has been granted access to the instance of SQL Server.
member.returns: A object value that contains a list of Windows users that have explicitly granted access to the instance of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description account nameThe name of the Windows NT user. NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM, for example.typeThe type of user. This specifies whether the user is an individual account or a group account.
member.param: A value that specifies a Windows user account on which to limit the results.

A value that specifies whether to list the all the permissions paths (other groups) through which the user has been granted access to the instance of SQL Server.If True, the permissions paths are listed.If False, the permissions paths are not listed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server.Grant(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerPermissionSet,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Grants the specified set of permissions to the grantee and the ability to grant the set of permissions to other users on the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server under an assumed role.
member.param: A object that specifies the permission.

A property that specifies whether the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.If True, the grantee is given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.If False, the grantee is not given the ability to grant the specified set of permissions to other users on the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server.
A value that specifies a grantee to be denied access to the permission.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting the specified set of permissions to other users on the instance of MicrosoftSQL Server. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger
member.summary: The object represents a MicrosoftSQL Server data definition language (DDL) trigger.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.#ctor(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class on the specified instance of MicrosoftSQL Server and with the specified name.
member.param: A value that specifies the name of the database DDL trigger.
A object value that specifies the instance of SQL Server on which the database data definition language (DDL) trigger is created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.#ctor(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server,System.String,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTriggerEventSet,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class on the specified database with the specified name. The trigger responds to the specified event set and runs the specified batch.
member.param: A object that specifies the DDL events to which the trigger responds.
A value that specifies the name of the server data definition language (DDL) trigger.
A object value that specifies the parent of the object.
A value that specifies the Transact-SQL batch statement that runs when the trigger has been raised.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.#ctor(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server,System.String,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTriggerEventSet,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class on the specified instance of MicrosoftSQL Server and with the specified name. The trigger responds to the specified event set and runs the specified batch.
member.param: A object that specifies the DDL events to which the DDL trigger responds.
A value that specifies the name of the server data definition language (DDL) trigger.
A value that specifies the name of the class in the registered assembly.
A object value that specifies the parent of the object.
A value that specifies the method within the class that runs when the DDL trigger is raised.
A value that specifies the name of the registered assembly that contains the user-defined function that runs when the DDL trigger is raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.AnsiNullsStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether SQL-92 NULL handling is enabled in the data definition language (DDL) trigger.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether SQL-92 NULL handling is enabled in the DDL trigger. SQL-92 NULL handling requires that any comparison to a NULL value equates to a NULL value.If True, SQL-92 NULL handling is enabled and comparisons to null values equates to False.If False (default), SQL-92 NULL handling is disabled and comparisons to null values equates to True.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.AssemblyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the assembly that contains the managed code that is executed when the data definition language (DDL) trigger is raised.
member.returns: A value that specifies the name of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.BodyStartIndex
member.summary: Gets the index value that represents the start of the data definition language (DDL) trigger text body.
member.returns: An value that specifies the index that represents the start of the DDL trigger text body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.ClassName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the class in the assembly that contains the managed code that is executed when the data definition language (DDL) trigger is raised.
member.returns: A value that specifies the name of the class in the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.CreateDate
member.summary: Gets the date and time when the server data definition language (DDL) trigger was created.
member.returns: A system object value that specifies the date and time when the server DDL trigger was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.DateLastModified
member.summary: Gets the date and time when the server data definition language (DDL) trigger was last modified.
member.returns: A system object value that specifies the date and time when the server DDL trigger was last modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.DdlTriggerEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of data definition language (DDL) events that raise the server DDL trigger.
member.returns: A object that specifies the events that raise the server DDL trigger.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.ExecutionContextLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login under the context of which the server DDL trigger executes.
member.returns: A object that specifies the events that raise the server DDL trigger.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.ID
member.summary: Gets the ID value that uniquely identifies the server data definition language (DDL) trigger.
member.returns: An value that specifies the ID value of the server DDL trigger.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.ImplementationType

member.returns: An object that specifies the implementation type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether the server data definition language (DDL) trigger is enabled.
member.returns: A property value that specifies whether the server DDL trigger is enabled.If True, the server DDL trigger is enabled.If False (default), the server DDL trigger is disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether the Transact-SQL batch or managed code is encrypted.
member.returns: A property value that specifies whether the trigger code is encrypted.If True, the trigger code is encrypted.If False (default), the trigger code is not encrypted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.IsSystemObject
member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the server data definition language (DDL) trigger is a system object.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the server DDL trigger is a system object.If True, the server DDL trigger is a system object.If False (default), the server DDL trigger is user defined.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object that is the parent of the object.
member.returns: A object that is the parent of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.QuotedIdentifierStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets a property value that specifies whether identifiers delimited by double quotation marks are Transact-SQL reserved keywords or contain characters not usually allowed by the Transact-SQL syntax rules.
member.returns: A value that specifies how quoted identifiers are handled in the server data definition language (DDL) trigger.If True, quoted identifiers are used to allow characters not usually allowed by the Transact-SQL syntax rules.If False (default), quoted identifiers are used to specify Transact-SQL reserved keywords.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerDdlTrigger.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the Transact-SQL statement that defines the server data definition language (DDL) trigger.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServerPermissionSet.AdministerBulkOperations
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to include the ADMINISTER BULK OPERATIONS (ADBO) permission in the permission set. This permission lets the grantee perform bulk insert operations on the instance of SQL Server, such as importing data by using the bcp command, using the BULK INSERT statement, or using the INSERT…SELECT * FROM OPENROWSET(BULK…) statement.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to include the ADMINISTER BULK OPERATIONS (ADBO) permission in the permission set.If True, the permission is included in the permission set.If False (default), the permission is excluded from the permission set.

A value that specifies the system path location of the file to which to save the service master key.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServiceMasterKey.Import(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the service master key from the file located at the specified system path using the specified password.
member.param: A value that specifies the password supplied when the service master key was saved to file.
A value that specifies the system path location of the file to which to save the service master key.

member.summary: Recovers a service master key, in case the service master key has been changed external to SQL Server.

A value that specifies the old account that was used to open the service master key.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServiceMasterKey.Regenerate
member.summary: Regenerates the database master key using the specified new password.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ServiceMasterKey.Regenerate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Regenerates the service master key with the option to force the regeneration thus removing all items that cannot be successfully decrypted.
member.param: A value that specifies whether to drop the items that cannot be successfully regenerated.If True, regeneration of the master key is forced and all items that cannot be regenerated are dropped.If False, regeneration of the master key is not forced.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.Default
member.summary: Data in pages located at the end of a file is moved to pages earlier in the file. Files are truncated to reflect allocated space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.EmptyFile
member.summary: Migrates all of the data from the referenced file to other files in the same filegroup. (and objects only).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.NoTruncate
member.summary: Data in pages located at the end of a file is moved to pages earlier in the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ShrinkMethod.TruncateOnly
member.summary: Data distribution is not affected. Files are truncated to reflect allocated space, recovering free space at the end of any file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SmoApplication.EnumAvailableSqlServers
member.summary: Enumerates a list of available instances of MicrosoftSQL Server.
member.returns: A system object value that contains an enumerated list of information about the available instances of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description NameThe name of the instance of SQL Server.ServerThe name of the server on which the instance of SQL Server is installed.InstanceThe instance of SQL Server.IsClusteredA Boolean value that is true if the instance is participating in failover clustering, or false if it is not.VersionThe version of the instance of SQL Server.IsLocalA Boolean value that is true if the instance is local, or false if the instance is remote.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SmoApplication.EnumAvailableSqlServers(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of local available instances of MicrosoftSQL Server.
member.returns: A system object value that contains an enumerated list of information about the available instances of SQL Server. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description NameThe name of the instance of SQL Server.ServerThe name of the server on which the instance of SQL Server is installed.InstanceThe instance of SQL Server.IsClusteredA Boolean value that is true if the instance is participating in failover clustering, or false if it is not.VersionThe version of the instance of SQL Server.IsLocalA Boolean value that is true if the instance is local, or false if the instance is remote.
member.param: A value that specifies whether local instances are listed or all instances available on the network.If True, only local instances are listed.If False, all instances are listed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SmoApplication.EnumAvailableSqlServers(System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates a list of available instances of MicrosoftSQL Server that are installed on the computer with the specified instance name.
member.returns: A system object value that contains an enumerated list of information about the available instances of SQL Server on the specified computer.If a single instance of SQL Server is specified in the name parameter, instead of a computer name, results are returned for the specified instance only. The table describes the different columns of the returned . Column Data type Description NameThe name of the instance of SQL Server.ServerThe name of the server on which the instance of SQL Server is installed.InstanceThe instance of SQL Server.IsClusteredA Boolean value that is true if the instance is participating in failover clustering, or false if it is not.VersionThe version of the instance of SQL Server.IsLocalA Boolean value that is true if the instance is local, or false if the instance is remote.
member.param: A value that specifies the name of the computer on which the instances of SQL Server are installed or a single instance of SQL Server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the ways in which statistical information is collected from tables or views during the creation or update of a statistic counter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Default
member.summary: Value = 5. Specifies that a percentage of the table or indexed view is used when collecting statistics. The actual percentage is calculated by the Microsoft SQL Server engine automatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.FullScan
member.summary: Value = 3. Specifies that all rows in the table or view are read when gathering statistics. This option must be used if a view is specified and it references more than one table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Percent
member.summary: Value = 1. Specifies that a percentage of the table or indexed view is used when collecting statistics. This options cannot be used if a view is specified and it references more than one table. When specified, use the sampleValue argument to indicate number of rows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Resample
member.summary: Value = 4. Specifies that the percentage ratio of the table or indexed view used when collecting statistics is inherited from existing the statistics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsScanType.Rows
member.summary: Value = 2. Specifies that a number of rows in the table or indexed view are used when collecting statistics. This option cannot be used if a view is specified and it references more than one table. When specified, use the sampleValue argument to indicate number of rows.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the type of statistic targeted for the update operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget.All
member.summary: Value = 3. Statistical information is collected for columns and indexes. This option is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget.Column
member.summary: Value = 1. Statistical information is collected for columns only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.StatisticsTarget.Index
member.summary: Value = 2. Statistical information is collected for indexes only.

A value that specifies the role that the user assumes when granting the specified set of permissions to other users on the stored procedure. Use this parameter for grantees who are members of more than one role.

member.summary: Gets the property value that specifies whether the user-defined data type is variable in length.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the user-defined data type is variable in length.If True, the user-defined data type represents a data type that can vary in length, such as varchar(4).If False (default), the user-defined data type represents a data type that cannot vary in length, such as char(4).A 2-character value retrieved from a user-defined data type defined as varchar(4) is returned as 2 characters. However, the same value retrieved from a user-defined data type type defined as char(4) is padded and returned as 4 characters.
